UniProt Entry.description: The amino acid sequence of the current peptide coincides with the part of the UniProt entry that may represent a peptide precursor.

Literature.Title: Functional Roles of Aromatic Residues and Helices of Papiliocin in its Antimicrobial and Anti-inflammatory Activities.
Literature.Author: Lee E, Kim JK, Jeon D, Jeong KW, Shin A, Kim Y

Sequence Information.Target Organism: Escherichia coli KCTC 1682(MIC=0.25µM),Pseudomonas aeruginosa KCTC 1637(MIC=0.50µM),Salmonella typhimurium KCTC 1926(MIC=0.50µM),Bacillus subtilis KCTC 3068(MIC=64µM),Enterococcus faecalis KCTC 2011(MIC=128µM),Staphylococcus aureus KCTC 1621(MIC=128µM),Salmonella typhimurium CCARM 8009(MIC=1.0µM),Escherichia coli CCARM 1229(MIC=1.0µM),Pseudomonas aeruginosa CCARM 2095(MIC=1.0µM),Acinetobacter baumannii CCARM 12035(MIC=0.50µM),Murine macrophage cells RAW 264.7(no activity data)
